Title: Example: The Mom Test Framework
Content: The key to getting useful feedback is asking questions about the past rather than the future. Instead of asking 'Would you use this?' ask 'Tell me about the last time you dealt with [problem].' Instead of 'Would you pay for this?' ask 'How much have you spent trying to solve this?' People are terrible at predicting their future behavior but accurate about reporting past behavior. This is the core of the Mom Test - asking questions even your mom couldn't lie to you about...
Summary: Framework for asking questions that get honest customer feedback instead of polite lies.

Title: Example: Validation Before Building
Content: The most expensive way to validate an idea is to build it. Every line of code, every design decision, every feature you add before talking to customers is a bet placed with no information. The entrepreneurs who move fastest are the ones who validate slowest - they spend more time in conversation and less time in construction...
Summary: Why building is the slowest path to validation and how to test ideas without code.
